fixes.name: Index
fixes.solution_explanation: The Tableau expression uses the table calculation INDEX(), which has no direct one-to-one DAX equivalent without additional information about row ordering or a unique row identifier. Implementing the same behavior in Power BI requires providing a row-level key and an explicit ranking expression (for example using RANKX over a specified ordering) or calculating the index in the visual layer. Because the original formula depends on Tableau's table calculation context, it cannot be reliably converted to a row-level calculated column here.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation uses a Tableau table calculation (INDEX()), which requires table/visual context (windowing) and therefore must be implemented as a measure in Power BI.
